disclaimerText: This forecast is intended to provide information on expected pollution levels in areas of significant public exposure. It may not apply in very specific locations close to unusually strong or short-lived local sources of pollution.

currentForecast.forecastSummary: Low air pollution forecast valid from Monday 30 May to end of Wednesday 1 June GMT
currentForecast.forecastText: Cooler temperatures are expected, with cloud and occasional heavy, thundery showers.<br/>Winds should be northerly with a relatively 'clean' air flow. <br/><br/>With adequate dispersion of local emissions, air pollution is expected to remain 'Low' throughout the forecast period for the following pollutants:<br/><br/>Nitrogen Dioxide<br/>Ozone<br/>PM10 Particulate<br/>PM2.5 Particulate<br/>Sulphur Dioxide<br/><br/>

currentForecast.forecastSummary: Low air pollution forecast valid from Thursday 2 June to end of Thursday 2 June GMT
currentForecast.forecastText: Thursday is expected to be warm and dry with a more easterly air flow.  <br/><br/>Currently back trajectories are indicating that the air will have circulated over the North Sea before arrival to the UK so should be realtively 'clean' with little pollution import.<br/><br/>With adequate dispersion of local emissions, air pollution is expected to remain 'Low' throughout the forecast period for the following pollutants:<br/><br/>Nitrogen Dioxide<br/>Ozone<br/>PM10 Particulate<br/>PM2.5 Particulate<br/>Sulphur Dioxide<br/><br/>
